article_title: Kaiser’s new medical school could be a giant step toward physician diversity
article_text:
Health giant Kaiser Permanente to open a new medical school by 2019

With nearly 20 percent of Californians as members, emphasis will be on diversity

New doctors also will learn Kaiser emphasis on integrated high-tech health care

article_metadata.news-keywords: kaiser permanente, kaiser, medical schools, kaiser medical school, california medical schools, diversity physicians, physician shortage
article_metadata.description: Though California is among the most diverse places in the nation, its doctors, unfortunately, don’t reflect the demographics of the state. Overall, physicians here are older, whiter and more likely to be male than their patients, and that’s just one of several ways in which California’s health care lags the demands of the market, not to mention patients’ needs.
article_metadata.title: Kaiser’s new medical school could be a giant step toward physician diversity | The Sacramento Bee
